summary: John R. Tunheim was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents indicate his involvement in overseeing the declassification and release of JFK assassination records, corresponding with the CIA regarding the release of information, and addressing concerns about the pace of declassification. He was involved in requesting additional information from the CIA regarding various files, individuals, and operations related to the JFK assassination. His role was crucial in ensuring compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992.
significance: John R. Tunheim's significance lies in his role as a member of the ARRB, which was responsible for the declassification and release of JFK assassination records. His involvement was crucial in ensuring compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 and in overseeing the process of making these records available to the public.
